1.brief: David, the youngest son of Jesse
properly, instrumental music; by implication, a poem set to notes
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
to place (in a very wide application)
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda

2.brief: a branch (as extending); figuratively, a tribe; also a rod, whether for chastising (figuratively, correction), ruling (a sceptre), throwing (a lance), or walking (a staff; figuratively, a support of life, e.g. bread)
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
to tread down, i.e. subjugate; specifically, to crumble off
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)

3.brief: a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
properly (abstractly) spontaneity, or (adjectively) spontaneous; also (concretely) a spontaneous or (by inference, in plural) abundant gift
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
probably a force, whether of men, means or other resources; an army, wealth, virtue, valor, strength
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity

4.brief: to seven oneself, i.e. swear (as if by repeating a declaration seven times)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to sigh, i.e. breathe strongly; by implication, to be sorry, i.e. (in a favorable sense) to pity, console or (reflexively) rue; or (unfavorably) to avenge (oneself)
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
Malki-Tsedek, an early king in Palestine
Malki-Tsedek, an early king in Palestine

5.brief: the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south
to dash asunder; by implication, to crush, smash or violently plunge; figuratively, to subdue or destroy
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire

6.brief: a straight course, i.e. sail direct
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
a body, whether alive or dead
to dash asunder; by implication, to crush, smash or violently plunge; figuratively, to subdue or destroy
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)

7.brief: a stream, especially a winter torrent; (by implication) a (narrow) valley (in which a brook runs); also a shaft (of a mine)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
